pageContext.title: Soweto `76, A Living Digital Archive
pageContext.description_excerpt: The goal of Soweto '76 is to provide users with virtual access to the history of Soweto, a Black township outside Johannesburg, so that they may experience a significant period in South Africa's history. Using existing oral histories, testimonies, photographs, video footage, material objects, and sound recordings in the collections of the Hector Pieterson Memorial & Museum, the work seeks to redress the existing portrayal of the lives of township residents in the mainstream or "official" historical record.
pageContext.participants: Angel David Nieves, Bini Tecle, Doug Reside, Gregory Lord
